intro: Shawia floribunda, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Shawia floribunda thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in horticulture.
